title: ICE: "region constraints already solved'": with_negative_coherence

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code `./src/test/ui/coherence/coherence-negative-outlives-lifetimes.rs` ```Rust #![feature(negative_impls)] // FIXME: this should compile trait MyPredicate<'a> {} impl<'a, T> !MyPredicate<'a> for &T where T: 'a {} trait MyTrait<'a> {} impl<'a, T: MyPredicate<'a>> MyTrait<'a> for T {} impl<'a, T> MyTrait<'a> for &'a T {} //~^ ERROR: conflicting implementations of trait `MyTrait<'_>` for type `&_` fn main() {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0-nightly (93ffde6f0 2022-07-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 93ffde6f04d3d24327a4e17a2a2bf4f63c246235 commit-date: 2022-07-23 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.64.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.6 ``` ### Error output `rustc ./src/test/ui/coherence/coherence-negative-outlives-lifetimes.rs "-Zcrate-attr=feature(with_negative_coherence)"` ``` ```
Backtrace
